alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Jefferson; Johnson; Laurens; Telfair; Treutlen; Wilcox (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 9:27AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Laurens, Emanuel, southern Dodge, Telfair, Treutlen, southeastern Wilcox, eastern Johnson, Wheeler, southeastern Jefferson and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 1015 AM EST... At 927 AM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Bartow to near Lowery to Abbeville, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Swainsboro, McRae, Eastman, Soperton, Abbeville, Alamo, Mount Vernon, Helena, Wadley, Lumber City, Glenwood, Milan, Adrian, Ailey, Rhine, Scotland, Chauncey, Bartow, Summertown and Nunez. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon EST for central and east central Georgia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 PM EST for central, southeastern and east central Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Dodge; Jefferson; Johnson; Laurens; Telfair; Treutlen; Wilcox
